title: Wind Cave National Park: Birds
body: Birds       Common names and taxonomic order are from the A.O.U. Checklist, 2003. Click here to view results of the park's December Bird Count. Abundance:     C  Common likely to see in proper habitat    U  Uncommon possible to see in proper habitat    R  Rare unlikely to see even in proper habitat     Residence:     PR  Permanent Resident    S  Summer Resident    W  Winter Resident    M  Migrant      Please report observations of unlisted or rare species at the park visitor center. Click to listen to the bird's call. Most sound files are large.         Geese, Ducks  Abundance   Residence    Snow Goose Chen caerulescens  R   M    Ross's Goose Chen rossii  R   M    Canada Goose Branta canadensis 92k wma file  R   M    Wood Duck Aix sponsa  R   M    Gadwall Anas strepera  R   M    American Wigeon Anas americana  R   M    Mallard Anas platyrhynchos  C,U   M,S    Blue-winged Teal Anas discors  C   M    Cinnamon Teal Anas cyanoptera  R   M    Northern Shoveler Anas clypeata  U   M    Northern Pintail Anas acuta 29k wma file  R   M    Green-winged Teal Anas crecca  U   M    Red Head Aythya americana  R   M    Ring-necked Duck Aythya collaris  R   M    Lesser Scaup Aythya affinis  R   M    Bufflehead Bucephala albeola  R   M             Fowl-like Birds  Abundance   Residence    Gray Partridge Perdix perdix  R   PR    Ring-neck Pheasant Phasianus colchicus 37k wma file  R   PR    Sharp-tailed Grouse Tympanuchus phasianellus 60k wma file  U   PR    Northern Bobwhite Colinus virginianus  R   M    Wild Turkey Meleagris gallopavo  U   PR              Grebes, Pelicans, Cormorants   Abundance   Residence    Pied-billed Grebe Podilymbus podiceps  R   M    Red Necked Grebe Podiceps grisegena  R   M    Eared Grebe Podiceps nigricollis  R   M    Western Grebe Aechmophorus occidentalis  R   M    American White Pelican Pelecanus erythrorhynchos  R   M    Double-crested Cormorant Phalacrocorax auritus 53k wma file  R   M             Herons, Bitterns  Abundance   Residence    American Bittern Botaurus lentiginosus more information...
